body: // UNSENT, Client has been created. open() not called yet.
// HEADERS_RECEIVED, send() has been called, and headers and status are available.
// LOADING, Downloading; responseText holds partial data.
// Properties: onreadystatechange, readyState, response, responseText, responseType, responseURL, responseXML, status, statusText, timeout, upload, withCredentials
// Methods: open(), abort(), send(), setRequestHeader(), overrideMimeType(), getAllResponseHeaders(), getResponseHeader(),
// Events: loadstart, progress, abort, error, load, timeout, loadend
// reject on network failure or if anything prevented the request from completing.
// wonâ€™t reject on HTTP error status even if the response is an HTTP 404 or 500,
// it will resolve normally (with ok status set to false)

Array.isArray().description:
Array.isArray(value);
return 'true' if the value is an Array; otherwise, 'false'.

Array.from(arrayLike).description:
Array.from(arrayLike);
return a new Array instance, shallow-copied Array instance from an array-like or iterable object.

Array.of(elementN).description:
Array.of(elementN);
return a new Array instance.

array.concat.description:
let newArray = oldArray.concat([value1[, value2[, ...[, valueN]]]]);
return a new array

array.copyWithin.description:
array.copyWithin(target[, start[, end]]);
return the modified array

array.entries.description:
array.entries();
return a new Array Iterator object that contains the key/value pairs for each index in the array.

array.fill.description:
array.fill(value[, start[, end]]);
return the modified array

array.filter.description:
let newArray = array.filter(callback(element[, index[, array]])[, thisArg]);
return a new array

array.find.description:
array.find(callback[, thisArg]);
return the value of the first element in the array that satisfies the provided testing function. Otherwise 'undefined' is returned.

array.flat(depth).description:
let newArray = array.flat([depth]);
return a new array

array.flatMap(callback).description:
let newArray = array.flatMap(function callback(currentValue[, index[, array]]) { }[, thisArg]);
return a new array with each element being the result of the callback function and flattened to a depth of '1'.

array.includes.description:
array.includes(valueToFind[, fromIndex]);
return a Boolean value

array.indexOf.description:
array.indexOf(searchElement[, fromIndex]);
return the first index of the element in the array; '-1' if not found.

array.join.description:
array.join([separator]);
return a string with all array elements joined. If array.length is 0, the empty string is returned.

array.keys.description:
array.keys();
returns a new Array Iterator object that contains the keys for each index in the array.

array.lastIndexOf.description:
array.lastIndexOf(searchElement[, fromIndex]);
return the last index of the element in the array; '-1' if not found.

array.map.description:
let newArray = array.map(function callback(currentValue[, index[, array]]) { }[, thisArg]);
return a new array with each element being the result of the callback function.

array.pop.description:
array.pop();
return the removed element from the array; 'undefined' if the array is empty.

array.push.description:
arr.push(element1[, ...[, elementN]]);
return the new length of the array.

array.reduce.description:
array.reduce(callback(accumulator, currentValue[, index[, array]]), [, initialValue]);
return The single value that results from the reduction.

array.reduceâ€‹Right.description:
array.reduceRight(callback(accumulator, currentValue[, index[, array]])[, initialValue]);
return the value that results from the reduction.

array.shift.description:
array.shift();
return the removed element from the array; 'undefined' if the array is empty.

array.slice.description:
array.slice([begin[, end]]);
 return a shallow copy of a portion of an array into a new array object selected from begin to end (end not included). The original array will not be modified.

array.sort.description:
array.sort([compareFunction(firstEl, secondEl)]);
return the sorted array. Note that the array is sorted in-place, and no copy is made.

array.unshift.description:
array.unshift(element1[, ...[, elementN]])();
return the new length of the array.

array.values.description:
array.values();
return a new Array Iterator object that contains the values for each index in the array.

array[Symbol.iterator]().description:
array[Symbol.iterator]();
The initial value of the @@iterator property is the same function object as the initial value of the values() property.

encodeURI(URI).description:
encodeURI(URI)
encodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character (will only be four escape sequences for characters composed of two 'surrogate' characters).
new string representing the provided string encoded as a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

decodeURI(encodedURI).description:
decodeURI(encodedURI)
decodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) previously created by encodeURI() or by a similar routine.
return a new string representing the unencoded version of the given encoded Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
throws an URIError ('malformed URI sequence') exception when encodedURI contains invalid character sequences.

encodeURIComponent(str).description:
encodeURIComponent(str)
encodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character (will only be four escape sequences for characters composed of two 'surrogate' characters).
return a new string representing the provided string encoded as a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component.

decodeURIComponent(encodedURI).description:
decodeURIComponent(encodedURI)
decodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component previously created by encodeURIComponent or by a similar routine.
throws an URIError ('malformed URI sequence') exception when used wrongly.

body: throw new RangeError(${1:"Sorry, you just don't have the range."});
throw new ReferenceError(${1:"You didn't cite your references properly."});
throw new SyntaxError(${1:"I don't like your syntax."});
throw new TypeError(${1:'What type of variable do you take me for?'});
throw new URIError(${1:'Uri, is that you?'});

function property.description: function as a property of an object

yield.description: The yield keyword is used to pause and resume a generator function (function* or legacy generator function).

yield*.description: The yield* expression is used to delegate to another generator or iterable object.

Math.random.description: The Math.random() function returns a floating-point, pseudo-random number in the range 0â€“1 (inclusive of 0, but not 1) with approximately uniform distribution over that range.

Math.round.description: The Math.round() function returns the value of a number rounded to the nearest integer.

Math.floor.description: The Math.floor() function returns the largest integer less than or equal to a given number.

Math.ceil.description: The Math.ceil() function always rounds a number up to the next largest whole number or integer.

Math.trunc.description: The Math.trunc() function returns the integer part of a number by removing any fractional digits.

import all module as alias.description: Import all of a module's exports as a module object

import without module name.description: Import a module for side effects only

Numberâ€‹.MAX_VALUE.description: The MAX_VALUE property has a value of approximately 1.79E+308, or 21024. Values larger than MAX_VALUE are represented as Infinity.

Numberâ€‹.MIN_VALUE.description:
The MIN_VALUE property is the number closest to 0, not the most negative number, that JavaScript can represent.
MIN_VALUE has a value of approximately 5e-324. Values smaller than MIN_VALUE ('underflow values') are converted to 0.

Numberâ€‹.isFinite().description: return a Boolean indicating whether or not the given value is a finite number.

Numberâ€‹.isInteger().description: return a Boolean indicating whether or not the given value is an integer.

Numberâ€‹.isNaN().description: return **true** if the given value is NaN and its type is Number; otherwise, **false**.

Numberâ€‹.isSafeâ€‹Integer().description: return a Boolean indicating whether or not the given value is a number that is a safe integer.

Numberâ€‹.parseâ€‹Float().description: parses a string argument and returns a floating point number.

Numberâ€‹.parseInt().description:
Number.parseInt(string,[ radix])
parses a string argument and returns an integer of the specified radix or base.

number.toExponential().description:
number.toExponential([fractionDigits])
return a string representing the Number object in exponential notation.

number.toFixed().description:
numObj.toFixed([digits])
formats a number using fixed-point notation.

number.toPrecision().description:
number.toPrecision([precision])
return a string representing the Number object to the specified precision.

Object.defineProperty(data descriptors).description:
Object.defineProperties(obj, props)
data descriptors
defines new or modifies existing properties directly on an object, 
returning the object.

Object.defineProperty(accessor descripto.description:
Object.defineProperties(obj, props)
accessor descriptors
defines new or modifies existing properties directly on an object, 
returning the object.

Object.defineProperties.description:
Object.defineProperties(obj, props)
defines new or modifies existing properties directly on an object, 
returning the object.

Object.entries.description:
Object.entries(obj);
return an array of a given object's own enumerable string-keyed property [key, value] pairs.

Object.freeze.description:
Object.freeze(obj);
return the same object that was passed in.

Object.fromEntries.description:
Object.fromEntries(iterable);
transforms a list of key-value pairs into an object.

Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor.description:
Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(obj, propertyName);
return a property descriptor of the given property if it exists on the object, 'undefined' otherwise.

Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors.description:
Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors(obj);
return an object containing all own property descriptors of an object. Might be an empty object, if there are no properties.

Object.getOwnPropertyNames.description:
Object.getOwnPropertyNames(obj);
return an array of all properties (including non-enumerable properties except for those which use Symbol) found directly in a given object.

Object.getOwnPropertySymbols.description:
Object.getOwnPropertySymbols(obj);
return an array of all symbol properties found directly upon a given object.

Object.getPrototypeOf.description:
Object.getPrototypeOf(obj);
return the prototype of the given object. If there are no inherited properties, 'null' is returned.

Object.is.description:
Object.is(value1, value2);
determines whether two values are the same value

Object.isExtensible.description:
Object.isExtensible(obj);
determines if an object is extensible (whether it can have new properties added to it).

Object.isFrozen.description:
Object.isFrozen(obj);
determines if an object is frozen.

Object.isSealed.description:
Object.isSealed(obj);
determines if an object is sealed.

Object.keys.description:
Object.keys(obj);
return an array of a given object's own property names, in the same order as we get with a normal loop.

Object.preventExtensions.description:
Object.preventExtensions(obj);
return the object being made non-extensible.

Object.setPrototypeOf.description:
Object.setPrototypeOf(obj, prototype);
return the specified object.

Object.values.description:
Object.values(obj);
return an array of a given object's own enumerable property values, in the same order as that provided by a for...in loop (the difference being that a for-in loop enumerates properties in the prototype chain as well).

*obj.hasOwnProperty.description:
obj.hasOwnProperty(propertyName);
return a boolean indicating whether the object has the specified property as its own property (as opposed to inheriting it).

*obj.propertyIsEnumerable.description:
obj.propertyIsEnumerable(propertyName);
return a Boolean indicating whether the specified property is enumerable.

*obj.valueOf.description:
obj.valueOf();
 returns the primitive value of a **Objects** object

body: // Overrides the Behavior Of Writing to a property
proxy set.description:
Validating Properties Using the set Trap
Nicholas C. Zakas
https://github.com/nzakas/understandinges6/blob/master/manuscript/12-Proxies-and-Reflection.md#validating-properties-using-the-set-trap

body: // Overrides the Behavior Of Reading a property value
proxy get.description:
Object Shape Validation Using the get Trap
Nicholas C. Zakas
https://github.com/nzakas/understandinges6/blob/master/manuscript/12-Proxies-and-Reflection.md#object-shape-validation-using-the-get-trap

body: // Overrides the Behavior Of The 'in' operator
proxy has.description:
Hiding Property Existence Using the has Trap
Nicholas C. Zakas
https://github.com/nzakas/understandinges6/blob/master/manuscript/12-Proxies-and-Reflection.md#hiding-property-existence-using-the-has-trap

body: // Overrides the Behavior Of The 'delete' operator
proxy delete.description:
Preventing Property Deletion with the deleteProperty Trap
Nicholas C. Zakas
https://github.com/nzakas/understandinges6/blob/master/manuscript/12-Proxies-and-Reflection.md#preventing-property-deletion-with-the-deleteproperty-trap

proxy prototype.description:
Prototype Proxy Traps
Nicholas C. Zakas
https://github.com/nzakas/understandinges6/blob/master/manuscript/12-Proxies-and-Reflection.md#prototype-proxy-traps

proxy object extensibility.description:
Object Extensibility Traps
Nicholas C. Zakas
https://github.com/nzakas/understandinges6/blob/master/manuscript/12-Proxies-and-Reflection.md#object-extensibility-traps

proxy object property descriptor.description:
Property Descriptor Traps
Nicholas C. Zakas
https://github.com/nzakas/understandinges6/blob/master/manuscript/12-Proxies-and-Reflection.md#property-descriptor-traps

proxy ownKeys.description:
The ownKeys Trap
Nicholas C. Zakas
https://github.com/nzakas/understandinges6/blob/master/manuscript/12-Proxies-and-Reflection.md#the-ownkeys-trap

body: // Overrides the Behavior Of Calling a function
// Overrides the Behavior Of Calling a function with new
proxy function.description:
Function Proxies with the apply and construct Traps
Nicholas C. Zakas
https://github.com/nzakas/understandinges6/blob/master/manuscript/12-Proxies-and-Reflection.md#function-proxies-with-the-apply-and-construct-traps

regexObj.exec(str).description:
regexObj.exec(str)
executes a search for a match in a specified string.
return a result array, or **null**.

regexObj.test(str).description:
regexObj.test(str)
executes a search for a match between a regular expression and a specified string. 
return **true** or **false**.

for-in.description: The for...in statement iterates over all enumerable properties of an object that are keyed by strings (ignoring ones keyed by Symbols), including inherited enumerable properties.

for-of.description: The for...of statement creates a loop iterating over iterable objects, including: built-in String, Array, array-like objects (e.g., arguments or NodeList), TypedArray, Map, Set, and user-defined iterables. It invokes a custom iteration hook with statements to be executed for the value of each distinct property of the object.

String.fromCharCode().description:
String.fromCharCode(num1[, ...[, numN]])
return a string created from the specified sequence of UTF-16 code units.

Stringâ€‹.fromâ€‹Codeâ€‹Point().description:
String.fromCodePoint(num1[, ...[, numN]])
return a string created by using the specified sequence of code points.
a RangeError is thrown if an invalid Unicode code point is given (e.g. 'RangeError: NaN is not a valid code point').

Stringâ€‹.raw().description:
String.raw(callSite, ...substitutions)|String.raw`templateString`
return the raw string form of a given template string.

str.charAt().description:
str.charAt(index)
 returns a new string consisting of the single UTF-16 code unit located at the specified offset into the string.

str.charâ€‹CodeAt().description:
str.charCodeAt(index)
return an integer between 0 and 65535 representing the UTF-16 code unit at the given index.

str.codeâ€‹PointAt().description:
str.codePointAt(pos)
return a non-negative integer that is the Unicode code point value.

str.concat().description:
str.concat(string2[, string3, ..., stringN])
return a new string containing the combined text of the strings provided.

str.endsâ€‹With().description:
str.endsWith(searchString[, length])
return 'true' if the given characters are found at the end of the string; otherwise, 'false'.

str.includes().description:
str.includes(searchString[, position])
return 'true' if the search string is found anywhere within the given string; otherwise, 'false' if not.

str.indexOf().description:
str.indexOf(searchValue[, fromIndex])
return the index of the first occurrence of searchValue, or '-1' if not found.
An empty string searchValue will match at any index between '0' and str.length

str.lastâ€‹IndexOf().description:
str.lastIndexOf(searchValue[, fromIndex])
return the index of the last occurrence of the specified value; '-1' if not found.

str.localeâ€‹Compare().description:
referenceStr.localeCompare(compareString[, locales[, options]])
return a **negative** number if the reference string occurs before the compare string; **positive** if the reference string occurs after the compare string; **0** if they are equivalent.

str.match().description:
str.match(regexp)
return an **Array** whose contents depend on the presence or absence of the global (**g**) flag, or **null** if no matches are found.

str.matchAll().description:
str.matchAll(regexp)
return an iterator of all results matching a string against a regular expression, including capturing groups.

str.normalize().description:
str.normalize([form])
**form**
- NFC â€” Normalization Form Canonical Composition.
- NFD â€” Normalization Form Canonical Decomposition.
- NFKC â€” Normalization Form Compatibility Composition.
- NFKD â€” Normalization Form Compatibility Decomposition.
return the Unicode Normalization Form of a given string (if the value isn't a string, it will be converted to one first).
 thrown a **RangeError** is thrown if **form** isn't one of the values specified above.

str.padEnd().description:
str.padEnd(targetLength [, padString])
return a **String** of the specified length with the pad string applied at the end of the current string.

str.padâ€‹Start().description:
str.padStart(targetLength [, padString])
return a **String** of the specified length with the pad string applied from the start.

str.repeat().description:
str.repeat(count)
return a new string containing the specified number of copies of the given string.

str.replace().description:
str.replace(regexp|substr, newSubStr|function)
return a new string with some or all matches of a **pattern** replaced by a **replacement**. The **pattern** can be a string or a **RegExp**, and the **replacement** can be a string or a function to be called for each match. If **pattern** is a string, only the first occurrence will be replaced.
The original string is left unchanged.

str.search().description:
str.search(regexp)
return the index of the first match between the regular expression and the given string; if not found, **-1**.

str.slice().description:
str.slice(beginIndex[, endIndex])
return a new string containing the extracted section of the string.

str.split().description:
str.split([separator[, limit]])
return an Array of strings split at each point where the separator occurs in the given string.

str.startsâ€‹With().description:
str.startsWith(searchString[, position])
return **true** if the given characters are found at the beginning of the string; otherwise, **false**.

str.substring().description:
str.substring(indexStart[, indexEnd])
return the part of the string between the start and end indexes, or to the end of the string.

str.toLocaleâ€‹Lowerâ€‹Case().description:
str.toLocaleLowerCase([locale, locale, ...])
return a new string representing the calling string converted to lower case, according to any locale-specific case mappings.

str.toLocaleâ€‹Upperâ€‹Case().description:
str.toLocaleUpperCase([locale, locale, ...])
return a new string representing the calling string converted to upper case, according to any locale-specific case mappings.

str.toLowerâ€‹Case().description:
str.toLowerCase()
return a new string representing the calling string converted to lower case.

str.toUpperâ€‹Case().description:
str.toUpperCase()
return a new string representing the calling string converted to upper case.

str.trim().description:
str.trim()
return a new string representing the calling string stripped of whitespace from both ends.

str.trimEnd().description:
str.trimEnd()/trimRight()
return a new string representing the calling string stripped of whitespace from its (right) end.

str.trimâ€‹Start().description:
str.trimStart()/trimLeft()
return a new string representing the calling string stripped of whitespace from its beginning (left end).

Symbol.for.description: The `Symbol.for(key)` method searches for existing symbols in a runtime-wide symbol registry with the given key and returns it if found. Otherwise a new symbol gets created in the global symbol registry with this key.

Symbol.keyFor.description: The `Symbol.keyFor(sym)` method retrieves a shared symbol key from the global symbol registry for the given symbol.
